conbody.p: In this section four types of patterns in time series are discussed.

section.title: Trend component
section.p: Tend to ascending over time (positive trend) or descending(negative trend). It does not have to be linear. Sometimes only a trend referred to as the direction (ascending or descending) in which the changes take place.

section.title: Seasonality component
section.p: These are regular fluctuations per day, month, quarter (usually within one year). Sales of ice creams in the summer will be higher than in the winter. Seasonality always concerns a fixed, known period.

section.title: Cyclic component
section.p: These are fluctuations over a longer period of time, often for many years, through fluctuations in the business cycle. Characteristic is also that these periods have no fixed length. Can be omitted for a analysis on shorter periods. The business cycle is a combination of different factors or indicators.

section.title: Random component
section.p: These are irregular fluctuations that cannot explained. Also called accidental influences.
